Alternately, you could try the beef tartare served with blueberries and feta cheese, or the red beetroot risotto with balsamic vinegar. Unless of course you prefer the surprise menu. Excellent cocktails, such as the gin, basil, rosemary, thyme, lemon and olive oil Saint Basil, are on offer. In the summer, eat on the terrace facing the canal.

Envy
Prinsengracht 381
1016 HL Amsterdam

+31 20 344 6407

www.envy.nl/en

Menu: around 35 EUR

content.title: Door 74, a uniquely decorated bar with delicious cocktails

introduction.small: Door 74 is difficult to find, but once inside, you will be won over by the atmosphere.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Door 74, a uniquely decorated bar with delicious cocktails

paragraphs.text:
There is no sign over the door. This bar is well hidden, which makes it feel secretive, as if your best friend had given you the address. It is best to reserve, then ring the bell for admittance. Once inside, you will be seduced. The decor pays homage to the American "speakeasy", which illegally served alcohol during Prohibition. Everything is there, from the subdued light to the sophistication. At Door 74, appreciate the very original creations of the talented bartenders. The choice is enormous and you will have a hard time deciding among the original and classic cocktails, each more delicious than the last, in moderation of course. The Whiskey Sour - a mix of bourbon, lemon juice, sugar and egg white - is just one of the concoctions inviting you to leave your worries in the cloakroom…

Door 74
Reguliersdwarsstraat 741
1017 BN Amsterdam

+31 (0)63 404 5122

https://www.facebook.com/Door74

content.title: Club NL: excellent music for creatures of the night

introduction.small: The NL attracts both a local and tourist clientele as well as celebrities. Everyone enjoys its glamour.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Club NL: excellent music for creatures of the night

paragraphs.text:
Club NL, on the historic Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal avenue, never calms down. The Dutch 'beautiful young things' make this their meeting place, and it is clear why. The ambiance is one of timeless cool, but the fact that Mick Jagger stops by when he is giving a concert in Amsterdam doesn't hurt. If you like to visit the most fashionable spots, this is an important stop if you manage to get in.

The decor is dominated by red and velvet, right out of an Asian movie. Live musical performances and sets from the resident or international DJs shake the house. Located just behind Dam Square, Club NL is frequented by a mixed local and tourist crowd.

Club NL
Nieuwerijds Voorburgwal 169
1012 RK Amsterdam

+31 (0)20 622 7510

https://www.clubnl.nl

content.title: Restaurant RED: tournedos and lobster, the chef's specialities

introduction.small: Only lobster and beef are eaten here, sometimes on the same plate.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Restaurant RED: tournedos and lobster, the chef's specialities

paragraphs.text:
Some restaurants are concept-driven. This is the case for the very glamorous Restaurant RED. Located on the Keizergracht canal, this establishment with a Parisian feel is famous for its menu, which is limited to two dishes: Canadian lobster and tournedos beef filets…

The choice is yours, but if it is too difficult, take a half-portion of both for a succulent 'surf and turf.' Green salad and homemade chips accompany the dishes. Despite the enormous serving sizes, you may still hanker for dessert: between the chocolate soufflé and the cheesecake served with vanilla ice cream, you may be faced with another difficult choice. Accompany your dessert with a glass of port.

The dining room is very elegant with green walls and armchairs, mirrors, and a daring portrait of a woman on the ceiling. Of course, though, you will only have eyes for the contents of your plate…

Restaurant Red
Keizergracht 594
1017 EN Amsterdam

+31 20 320 18 24

https://restaurantred.nl/en/

Menu: around 36 EUR

content.title: Winkel 43's legendary apple pie

introduction.small: The house specialty, hot apple pie with whipped cream, is not to be missed.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Winkel 43's legendary apple pie

paragraphs.text:
Winkel 43 is truly an Amsterdam institution. Besides an excellent quality to price ratio, it is also known for its welcoming service. Open early in the morning and closing late at night, it's the place where everyone - from tourists to locals - comes for breakfast, lunch, or a late-night snack. The house specialty, hot apple pie served under a mountain of whipped cream, is reputed to be the best in Amsterdam, if not the world. If you are more on the savoury side, you will enjoy the quiche with caramelised onions, bacon and cheese, or the polenta served with cured ham, cherry tomatoes and basil mayo.

As a result of its success, the restaurant is often crowded, especially on weekends. If you can't find a seat, take your order to go and improvise a picnic along one of the neighbouring canals.

Winkel 43
Noordermarrkt 43
1015 NA Amsterdam

+31 (0)20 623 0223

https://winkel43.nl/en

Menu: from 3.50 to 11 EUR

content.title: CLIMATE AND WEATHER IN Amsterdam
content.introduction: Amsterdam has a temperate oceanic climate influenced by the proximity of the North Sea. Summer temperatures are warm but rarely hot, around 22°C (72°F) on average in July and August. Winters are humid and relatively mild. It rains quite frequently in Amsterdam (about 187 days per year). Owing to the comfortable temperatures, spring and summer are the best seasons to visit the city, stroll around the parks bursting with flowers, and walk or bike along the canals.

airports.title: Amsterdam Schiphol International Airport
airports.description:
The Amsterdam Schiphol International Airport is located about 17,5 kilometres (11 miles) south-west of the city centre.
  • 1 terminal

Getting from the airport to Amsterdam and back
  • By car
    • Accessible via the A4 motorway.
    • Several short- and long-term parking facilities are available at the airport:
          • "Short-term" parking lot (3 minutes from the airport by foot), EUR 1 for 10 minutes, EUR 40 per day.
          • "Long-term" parking lot (5 minutes from the airport with free shuttle). For 24 hours, EUR 40, EUR 67.50 for 48 hours.
          • “"Basic" parking lot for 3-day+ parking: reservations online, on the airport website.
          • "Valet" parking lot located between Departure halls 2 and 3, a valet taking care of your car. Key-drop at the Schiphol Valet Parking counter. EUR 47.50 for the first day. EUR 7.50 for each extra day.
    • Several car rental companies have counters at Schiphol Plaza, directly behind Arrivals
  • By rail
    • Trains leave for Amsterdam Centraal (the city's main train station) from the Schiphol station directly beneath the terminal complex. The trip takes about 15 minutes and the fare is EUR 5.50 (EUR 4.50 online: https://www.ns.nl/en) each way.
  • Bus
    • The bus station is located in front of Schiphol Plaza (directly in front of the arrivals and departure halls).
    • Bus line 397 connects the airport to Amsterdam's city centre. It leaves every 7-8 minutes from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 a.m. One-way ticket is EUR 3.50.
    • Night bus N97 (the Niteliner) to Amsterdam, from 1:00 a.m. to 5:00 a.m. One-way ticket is EUR 4.50.
    • Several buses connect the airport with more than 100 hotels in Amsterdam, with departures every 10 minutes between 6:00 a.m. and 9:00 p.m. Find more information at the desk in the airport.
  • Taxi
    • Taxis are available at the ranks outside the arrivals hall (from EUR 40 to central Amsterdam)
  • Services: shops, bars and restaurants, free Internet access (Wi-Fi) available in the airport.
  • Telephone: +31 (0)20 7940800
  • Website: https://www.schiphol.nl/en/

medical.title: Medical information
medical.description:
In order to travel in the best conditions and for your health and safety, we invite you to check all information regarding preventive measures and best practices to be respected, available on the official website of the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs: https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/country-files/

Your comfort, well-being and health are at the heart of Air France's concerns, and we want to help you prepare for your trip in the best way possible. Find out more about the measures taken to ensure safe travelling on our website: https://www.airfrance.fr/FR/en/common/page_flottante/information/coronavirus.htm#notre-engagement-sanitaire

See your doctor before you travel. It is also recommended to take out insurance covering medical expenses and repatriation before your trip. Amsterdam counts several hospitals and medical institutions, as well as quality medical practitioners and health specialists.

essentialPhrases.title: Essential phrases
essentialPhrases.introduction: Here are a few basic Dutch phrases that will make your stay in Amsterdam a little easier:
phrases: Hello / Good morning / Good afternoon: Goedendag / Goedemiddag
I don't understand: Ik begrijp het niet.
Could you repeat?: Kunt u dat herhalen ?
What time is it?: Hoe laat is het?
Sorry / Excuse me: Neem me niet kwalijk / Pardon / Sorry
How much is it?: Wat is de prijs van (…) ? / Wat kost (…) ?
Where can I find (…)?: Waar kan ik (…) vinden?
Where can I buy (…)?: Waar kan ik (…) kopen?

localCalendar.title: FESTIVALS, HOLIDAYS AND OTHER ANNUAL EVENTS IN Amsterdam
localCalendar.description: There are a number of festivals, holidays and other events celebrated in Amsterdam each year. The main ones are listed below.

events.title: January 1:  New Year's Day (Nieuwjaarsdag, national holiday)
January or February: Chinese New Year (local)
events.description: Each year, Amsterdam's Chinatown (one of the biggest in the world) celebrates the event with parades in the city streets and the Vondelpark. On the program: the lion's dance, paper dragons, traditional music and martial arts displays.

events.title: April 27:King's Day (Koningsdag, national holiday)
events.description: This is the most important secular festival of the year, celebrating King Willem-Alexander. Many of the revellers wear orange and the festivities are spread across town, with giant garage sales, fun fairs, concerts and numerous shows.

events.title: April: Bloemencorso Bollenstreek (local event)
events.description: This parade consists of a series of imaginative floats entirely decorated with millions of blooms, on a route from Leyde to Haarlem, large producer of flower bulbs only 20 kilometres from Amsterdam. Each year, the parade takes inspiration from a different theme, for the enjoyment of its thousands of spectators.

events.title: May to September: Vondelpark Open Air Theatre (Openluchttheater, local event)
events.description: Every year, Amsterdam's Chinatown district, one of the largest in the world, hosts the event with a long parade amidst the streets and into the Vondelpark. The program consists in: lion dances, paper dragons, folk music and martial arts displays.

events.title: December 6: Sinterklaas (local event)
events.description: A different Dutch town is chosen each year to host the event, starting point of Saint-Nicholas' long tour. Pakjesavond takes place on the eve of December 6<sup>th</sup>, celebration during which Saint-Nicholas distributes presents to children.

administrativeProcedures.title: Entry requirements to enter the Netherlands
administrativeProcedures.description:
As a French citizen, you do not need to obtain a visa if you will be staying in the Netherlands for less than three months. You need only be in possession of a valid passport. To enjoy peace of mind during your stay in Amsterdam and the Netherlands, be sure to check with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in your home country for the latest travel information and recommendations. Comprehensive information that may be helpful for international visitors is also provided on the Netherlands page of the U.S. State Department's travel Website: view information for travellers to the Netherlands
To enjoy peace of mind during your stay in the Netherlands and Amsterdam, be sure to check with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in your home country for the latest travel information and recommendations. Comprehensive information that may be helpful is also provided on the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs' website: https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/en/

Tipping
Tipping is appreciated at all restaurants, bars and cafés, and when paying for a taxi fare. It is customary to leave between 5 and 10 % if you are satisfied with the service.
